analyzed: / too ti dang byings nitsa mtha' can gyi sa yig ni aa bhy'a sa ain so sor bsdu ba'i pha rol la sha yig tu 'gyur te /
translated: The final syllable of the root and the syllable sa of the augment are changed to śa in the case of the augment of the aphorism avyayībhāva.

original: mdo 'dis sa shar bsgyur /
analyzed: mdo 'dis sa shar bsgyur /
translated: By this sūtra, sa is changed to śa.

original: sha tu la sha tu 'os /
analyzed: sha tu la sha tu 'os /
translated: In śat, śat is correct.

original: ta t aatsa han gam sogs kyis ring por bsgyur bas /
analyzed: ta t aatsa han gam sogs kyis ring por bsgyur bas /
translated: By tataḥ aṅgam, etc., it is lengthened.

original: (lat)...tusht'u sha ti /
analyzed: (lat)...tusht'u sha ti /
translated: (lat) tuṣṭāśi

original: (lung)...aa tusht'u sh'ita /
analyzed: (lung)...aa tusht'u sh'ita /
translated: (lung) atustuṣi

original: (lit)...tusht'u sh'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: (lit)...tusht'u sh'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: (lit) tuṣṭāśiṃ cākara

original: sogs so / ` / nyi shva pa nyal ba la'o zhes pa la ni tsa au pa dh'a'i 'os 'phel ba byas /
analyzed: sogs so / ` / nyi shva pa nyal ba la'o zhes pa la ni tsa au pa dh'a'i 'os 'phel ba byas /
translated: In the case of niśāśva, the augment of the aphorism is increased.

original: sv'a pi zhes pa la san sbyar /
analyzed: sv'a pi zhes pa la san sbyar /
translated: In svāpi, san is added.

original: ait byin / gnyis brjod /
analyzed: ait byin / gnyis brjod /
translated: It is a dvandva compound.

original: dyu ti sv'a pi dag gi sam pra s'a ra na 'os /
analyzed: dyu ti sv'a pi dag gi sam pra s'a ra na 'os /
translated: In dyūtaśvāpi, samprāsarana is correct.

original: aa bhy'a sa sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur /
translated: In avyayībhāvasamprāsarana, it is changed.

original: stoo ti dang ni dag gi aa bhy'a sa'i 'os sa shar bsgyur bas /🔽(lat)...su shv'a pa yi shya ti /
analyzed: stoo ti dang ni dag gi aa bhy'a sa'i 'os sa shar bsgyur bas / (lat)...su shv'a pa yi shya ti /
translated: In stota and ni, the augment of avyayībhāva is changed to śa.🔽(lat) susvāpayiṣyati🔽(lung) asusvāpayiṣyati

original: (lung)...aa su shv'a ba yi sh'ita /🔽(lit)...su shv'a pa yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: (lung)...aa su shv'a ba yi sh'ita /🔽(lit)...su shv'a pa yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: (lit) susvāpayiṣaṃ cākar

original: sogs so / ` / nyi shvi da mi gsal ba'i sgra la'o zhes pa la nitsa sbyar /
analyzed: sogs so / ` / nyi shvi da mi gsal ba'i sgra la'o zhes pa la nitsa sbyar /
translated: “ In the case of the word ‘niśvā’ it is the case of an unclear sound.

original: pu ka mtha' sogs kyis yon tan byas /🔽sve di zhes pa la san dang ait /
analyzed: pu ka mtha' sogs kyis yon tan byas / sve di zhes pa la san dang ait /
translated: The word ‘puka’ is a quality made by the suffix ‘ka’ and so on.🔽The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘san’ and ‘it.’

original: sa:svi di sva di sa h'a n'am tsa /
analyzed: sa:svi di sva di sa h'a n'am tsa /
translated: The words ‘svādī,’ ‘svādī,’ ‘sahāṃca,’

original: svi di sva di sa ha rnams kyi sa'ang ngo //🔽svi di mi gsal @387a * //
analyzed: svi di sva di sa ha rnams kyi sa'ang ngo // svi di mi gsal @387a * //
translated: and ‘sahā’ are also the case of the suffix ‘sa.’🔽The word ‘svādī’ is the case of an unclear sound.

original: ba'i sgra / sva di ro myang ba /
analyzed: ba'i sgra / sva di ro myang ba /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ means ‘to taste.’

original: sa ha bzod pa rnams kyi sa yig ni aa bhy'a sa ain so sor bsdu ba dang ni tsa'i mtha' yin kyang shar mi bsgyur ba sa yig tu gnas te /
analyzed: sa ha bzod pa rnams kyi sa yig ni aa bhy'a sa ain so sor bsdu ba dang ni tsa'i mtha' yin kyang shar mi bsgyur ba sa yig tu gnas te /
translated: The word ‘sahā’ means ‘to endure.’ The letter ‘sa’ is the case of the suffix ‘aṃ’ and the individual inclusion and the suffix ‘ca’ at the end, but the ‘śa’ is not changed to ‘ṣa.’🔽It is a double pronunciation.

original: gnyis brjod / hal dang po lhag po 'os /
analyzed: gnyis brjod / hal dang po lhag po 'os /
translated: The first ‘ha’ is a superabundant remainder.

original: ba phyis / mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas /🔽(lat).. ..si sve da yi sha ti /
analyzed: ba phyis / mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas / (lat).. ..si sve da yi sha ti /
translated: This sūtra does not change ‘śa’ to ‘ṣa.’🔽The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘si.’

original: (lung)...aa si sve da yi sh'ita /
analyzed: (lung)...aa si sve da yi sh'ita /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘as.’

original: (lit)...si sve da yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: (lit)...si sve da yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘sa’ and the action ‘ca.’🔽and so on.

original: sogs so / ` / sva da ro myang ba la /
analyzed: sogs so / ` / sva da ro myang ba la /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ means ‘to taste.’

original: nitsa au pa dh'a'i 'os 'phel ba byas pas /
analyzed: nitsa au pa dh'a'i 'os 'phel ba byas pas /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘ni’ and the increase of ‘au.’

original: sv'a di zhes pa la san ait byin /
analyzed: sv'a di zhes pa la san ait byin /
translated: The word ‘svādī’ is the case of the suffix ‘san’ and ‘it.’

original: gnyis brjod pa phyis /
analyzed: gnyis brjod pa phyis /
translated: The second is expressed later.

original: san la aita 'os aita du bsgyur /
analyzed: san la aita 'os aita du bsgyur /
translated: san is changed to ita.

original: mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas /
analyzed: mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas /
translated: Since this sūtra does not change śa,

original: (lat)...si sv'a da yi sha ti /
analyzed: (lat)...si sv'a da yi sha ti /
translated: [the form] is sīsādayiṣati.

original: (lung)...aa si sv'a da yi sh'i ta /
analyzed: (lung)...aa si sv'a da yi sh'i ta /
translated: [The form] is asīsādayiṣyati.

original: (lit)...si sv'a da yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: (lit)...si sv'a da yi sh'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: [The form] is sīsādayiṣāṃ cakāra.🔽And so on.

original: sogs so / ` / sa ha bzod pa la ni tsa 'phel ba byas /
analyzed: sogs so / ` / sa ha bzod pa la ni tsa 'phel ba byas /
translated: In the case of kṣānti, sa is increased and changed to ca.🔽[The form] is kṣānti.

original: s'a hi zhes pa la san sbyar /
analyzed: s'a hi zhes pa la san sbyar /
translated: san is added.

original: ait byin / gnyis brjod /
analyzed: ait byin / gnyis brjod /
translated: The second is expressed.

original: san la ai ta 'os aita du bsgyur /
analyzed: san la ai ta 'os aita du bsgyur /
translated: san is changed to ita.

original: mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas /🔽(lat)...si s'a ha yi sha ti /
analyzed: mdo 'dis sa shar mi bsgyur bas / (lat)...si s'a ha yi sha ti /
translated: Since this sūtra does not change śa,🔽[the form] is sākṣādayiṣati.

original: (lung)...aa si s'a ha yi sh'i ta /
analyzed: (lung)...aa si s'a ha yi sh'i ta /
translated: [The form] is āsākṣādayiṣyati.

original: (lit)...si s'a ha yi sh'am tsak'a ra /
analyzed: (lit)...si s'a ha yi sh'am tsak'a ra /
translated: [The form] is sākṣādayiṣāṃ cakāra.🔽And so on.

original: sogs so / ` /'grel par rang don la byin pa'i san gyi mtha' la 'ang dgos pa yod na san sbyor ro zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: sogs so / ` /'grel par rang don la byin pa'i san gyi mtha' la 'ang dgos pa yod na san sbyor ro zhes bshad pas /
translated: Since the commentary explains that if there is a purpose for the addition of san to the end of the san that is given for one’s own purpose, san is added,

original: gu p'u sbed pa la gu pa ti dza kita rnams la san 'os /
analyzed: gu p'u sbed pa la gu pa ti dza kita rnams la san 'os /
translated: [the form] is guhyati for the protection of guhya.

original: san gnyis brjod pa sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: san gnyis brjod pa sogs kyis bsgrubs pas /
translated: Since san is added twice and so on,🔽[the form] is guhyati.

original: dzu gupsa zhes pa la byings las las dang 'dod pa byed pa po mnyam pa las yang na 'os /
analyzed: dzu gupsa zhes pa la byings las las dang 'dod pa byed pa po mnyam pa las yang na 'os /
translated: In jugupsa, the root is gup, meaning to protect, and the prefix ju is a negative particle.

original: slar yang san byin /
analyzed: slar yang san byin /
translated: Again, san is added.

original: gnyis brjod zin yin pas slar mi brjod /
analyzed: gnyis brjod zin yin pas slar mi brjod /
translated: Since du has already been expressed, it is not expressed again.

original: bal dang po'i ait aata kyi dbyi 'os aa phyis pas /
analyzed: bal dang po'i ait aata kyi dbyi 'os aa phyis pas /
translated: The i of the first ita and ata is elided, and the a is dropped.

original: dzu gupsi sha zhes pa la (lat)...sogs sbyar bas /🔽(lat)...dzu gupsi sha ti /🔽ling dzu gupsi shita /
analyzed: dzu gupsi sha zhes pa la (lat)...sogs sbyar bas / (lat)...dzu gupsi sha ti / ling dzu gupsi shita /
translated: Thus, jugupsa is applied with la, etc.🔽Thus, jugupsita.🔽With ling, jugupsita.

original: lot dzu gupsi shi tu /🔽lang aa dzu gupsi sha ta /
analyzed: lot dzu gupsi shi tu / lang aa dzu gupsi sha ta /
translated: With lot, jugupsita.🔽With lang, ajugupsata.

original: (lung)...aa dzu gupsi sh'ita /🔽(lit)...dzu gupsi sh'am tsa k'a ra /🔽(lut)...dzu gupsi shi t'a /
analyzed: (lung)...aa dzu gupsi sh'ita / (lit)...dzu gupsi sh'am tsa k'a ra / (lut)...dzu gupsi shi t'a /
translated: With lung, ajugupsita.🔽With lit, jugupsaṃ cakāra.🔽With lut, jugupsita.

original: (smon ling)...dzu gupsi shy'ata /🔽(lrit)...dzu gupsi shi shya ti /
analyzed: (smon ling)...dzu gupsi shy'ata / (lrit)...dzu gupsi shi shya ti /
translated: With moṅling, jugupsyāt.🔽With lṛt, jugupsiśyata.

original: (lring)...aa dzu gupsi shi shyata /🔽sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a kar na sya s'u tr'at+sa nanta:sa m'a pt'a:/
analyzed: (lring)...aa dzu gupsi shi shyata / sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a kar na sya s'u tr'at+sa nanta:sa m'a pt'a:/
translated: With lṛṅ, ajugupsiśyata, etc.🔽Thus ends the section on words ending in san from the Paṇini Vyākaraṇa Sūtra.

original: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las san mtha' can rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las san mtha' can rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus ends the section on words ending in san from the Paṇini Vyākaraṇa Sūtra.

original: // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las san gyi mtha' can rnams kyi
analyzed: // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las san gyi mtha' can rnams kyi
translated: This concludes the rough explanation of the rules for the saṃjñā-ending

original: cho ga rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /🔽// / gsum pa byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen yang gi 'jug yul rnams bshad @387b par bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so / // / gsum pa byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen yang gi 'jug yul rnams bshad @387b par bya ste /
translated: affixes.🔽The rules for the roots🔽Now I will explain the rules for the affixes that are the domain of the affix

original: dh'a to re k'a tso ha l'a de:kri y'a sa ma bhi h'a re yang /🔽byings aatsa gcig pa hal dang po las bya ba yang dag par sdud pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: dh'a to re k'a tso ha l'a de:kri y'a sa ma bhi h'a re yang / byings aatsa gcig pa hal dang po las bya ba yang dag par sdud pa la yang ngo //
translated: y, which is added to roots.🔽The affix y is added to roots ending in a vowel, and to roots ending in a🔽consonant, after the addition of a vowel.

original: rutsa 'bar ba dang shutsa mya ngan gnyis ma yin pa'i byings aatsa gcig pa hal dang po can las bya ba yang dag par sdud pa ste shin tu ba dang yang yang gi don la yang pha rol tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rutsa 'bar ba dang shutsa mya ngan gnyis ma yin pa'i byings aatsa gcig pa hal dang po can las bya ba yang dag par sdud pa ste shin tu ba dang yang yang gi don la yang pha rol tu 'gyur te /
translated: The affix y is added to roots ending in a consonant, after the addition of a🔽vowel.

original: nga yig ni san yang dag la 'os byings gnyis brjod pa'i don no //
analyzed: nga yig ni san yang dag la 'os byings gnyis brjod pa'i don no //
translated: The word api is a preposition meaning 'in two ways'.

original: 'grel par lung drangs pa /🔽s'u tsi s'u tri m'u tryat rtya sh'urno ti bhyo yang /
analyzed: 'grel par lung drangs pa / s'u tsi s'u tri m'u tryat rtya sh'urno ti bhyo yang /
translated: The commentary quotes a passage:🔽'Sauci sutri mutryatir yah,🔽sauci sutri mutri atati arti ashurnotibhyah,

original: s'u tsi s'u tri m'u tri aat ti aarti aa sha a'urno ti rnams las yang ngo //
analyzed: s'u tsi s'u tri m'u tri aat ti aarti aa sha a'urno ti rnams las yang ngo //
translated: sauci sutri mutri atati arti ashurnotibhyam,🔽sauci sutri mutri atati arti ashurnotibhyah.

original: s'u tsa phra ma /
analyzed: s'u tsa phra ma /
translated: Sauci means 'small'.

original: s'u tra rab tu grol ba /
analyzed: s'u tra rab tu grol ba /
translated: Sutri means 'completely liberated'.

original: m'u tra rab tu 'dzag pa /
analyzed: m'u tra rab tu 'dzag pa /
translated: Mutri means 'flowing'.

original: aat 'gro ba /
analyzed: aat 'gro ba /
translated: Ati means 'going'.

original: ri 'gro ba /
analyzed: ri 'gro ba /
translated: Ri means 'going'.

original: aa sha zas /
analyzed: aa sha zas /
translated: Asha means 'food'.

original: a'urnunya 'gebs pa rnams las shin tu ba dang yang yang gi ngon la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'urnunya 'gebs pa rnams las shin tu ba dang yang yang gi ngon la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Urnu means 'covering'.

original: ni tyam koo ti lyee ga too /
analyzed: ni tyam koo ti lyee ga too /
translated: Nityam kotil yai gatoh.

original: 'gro ba la 'khyog po kho na la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la 'khyog po kho na la'o //
translated: Only crooked going is for going.

original: 'gro ba'i don gyi byings las shin tu ba dang yang yang gi don ma yin pa'i 'khyog por 'gro ba kho na'i don la 'jug pa na yang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don gyi byings las shin tu ba dang yang yang gi don ma yin pa'i 'khyog por 'gro ba kho na'i don la 'jug pa na yang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When the root meaning 'going' is used for the meaning 'crooked going' which is not the meaning of 'very' or 'again', it becomes 'other side'.

original: lu pa sa da tsa ra dza pa dza bha da ha da sha gr'i bhyo bh'a ba garh'a y'am /
analyzed: lu pa sa da tsa ra dza pa dza bha da ha da sha gr'i bhyo bh'a ba garh'a y'am /
translated: Lupas dac carajapavaj bhadadasha garibhyobhava grahayam.

original: lu pa sa da tsa ra dza pa dza bha da ha da sha gr'i rnams las smad pa nyid la'o //🔽lupli gcod pa /🔽sha dli rnam par 'gro ba /
analyzed: lu pa sa da tsa ra dza pa dza bha da ha da sha gr'i rnams las smad pa nyid la'o // lupli gcod pa / sha dli rnam par 'gro ba /
translated: From śad, “to go,” come the forms śadita, “gone,” and śadana, “to go.”

original: tsa ra 'gro ba /🔽dza pa yid /
analyzed: tsa ra 'gro ba / dza pa yid /
translated: From cara, “to go,” come the forms carita, “gone,” and carana, “to go.”🔽From jiva, “mind,” come the forms jivita, “mind,” and jivana, “to live.”

original: dza bha lus rnam par nyams pa /🔽da ha thal bar byed pa /
analyzed: dza bha lus rnam par nyams pa / da ha thal bar byed pa /
translated: From jiva, “body,” come the forms jivita, “body,” and jivana, “to decay.”

original: da sha mche ba /
analyzed: da sha mche ba /
translated: From dhas, “to make dust,” come the forms dhasita, “made dust,” and dhasana, “to make dust.”

original: g'i gsal bar byed pa rnams las smad pa nyid la 'jug pa la yang 'gyur te bya ba yang dag par bsdu ba tsam la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: g'i gsal bar byed pa rnams las smad pa nyid la 'jug pa la yang 'gyur te bya ba yang dag par bsdu ba tsam la ni ma yin no /
translated: From gati, “to illuminate,” come the forms gati, “illuminated,” and gati, “to illuminate.”

original: ` / s'u tsa phra ma byed pa la'o zhes pa la yang /
analyzed: ` / s'u tsa phra ma byed pa la'o zhes pa la yang /
translated: From suca, “to slander,” come the forms sucita, “slandered,” and sucana, “to slander.”

original: san yang dag la 'os gnyis brjod /
analyzed: san yang dag la 'os gnyis brjod /
translated: From san, “to be suitable,” come the forms sanita, “suitable,” and sanana, “to be suitable.”

original: thung ngu 'os thung ngur bsgyur bas /🔽su s'u tsa /🔽yang zhes pa la /🔽gu no yang lu ko:/🔽yang 'jig pa dag la yon tan no //
analyzed: thung ngu 'os thung ngur bsgyur bas / su s'u tsa / yang zhes pa la / gu no yang lu ko:/ yang 'jig pa dag la yon tan no //
translated: From the short form of the root, the short form of the affix is used.🔽From gu, “to be,” come the forms guhita, “also,” and guhana, “to be.”🔽From gu, “to destroy,” come the forms guhita, “also,” and guhana, “to destroy.”

original: yang gi rkyen 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa dag pha rol la'ang aa bhy'a sa yon tan du bsgyur te /
analyzed: yang gi rkyen 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa dag pha rol la'ang aa bhy'a sa yon tan du bsgyur te /
translated: The affix gu is used for the qualities of destruction and nondestruction.

original: mdo 'dis yon tan byas pas /🔽so s'u tsya zhes grub pa la /
analyzed: mdo 'dis yon tan byas pas /🔽so s'u tsya zhes grub pa la /
translated: From this sūtra, the quality is formed.

original: lat sogs tang rnams sbyor te /
analyzed: lat sogs tang rnams sbyor te /
translated: affixes -ta and so forth are added.🔽The suffix -a is added to the agent, and the suffix -ta is added to the🔽object.

original: byed pa po la shapa aata las yon tan la 'os gnyis ngag gi gcig sngon ma'i gzugs su bsgyur bas /🔽(lat)...so s'u tsya te /
analyzed: byed pa po la shapa aata las yon tan la 'os gnyis ngag gi gcig sngon ma'i gzugs su bsgyur bas / (lat)...so s'u tsya te /
translated: [The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root la.

original: (ling)...so s'u tsye ta /🔽(lot)...so s'u tsya t'am /
analyzed: (ling)...so s'u tsye ta / (lot)...so s'u tsya t'am /
translated: [The word] “each one” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root liṅ.🔽[The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root loṭ.

original: (lang)...aa so s'u tsya ta /
analyzed: (lang)...aa so s'u tsya ta /
translated: [The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root laṅ.🔽And so forth.

original: sogs dang / lung la /
analyzed: sogs dang / lung la /
translated: In the aphorism,

original: ya sya hal:/ ya'i hal las so //
analyzed: ya sya hal:/ ya'i hal las so //
translated: yaḥ hal🔽from the root hal, the first half of the root ya is elided, and the other half

original: byings mtha' hal las pha rol gyi ya'i byings phyed pa pha rol la dbyi bar bya ste /
analyzed: byings mtha' hal las pha rol gyi ya'i byings phyed pa pha rol la dbyi bar bya ste /
translated: is elided in the other.

original: mdo 'dis ya phyis /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ya phyis /
translated: By this rule, the first half of ya is elided.

original: byings phyed pa'i bal dang po la ait 'os @388a * //
analyzed: byings phyed pa'i bal dang po la ait 'os @388a * //
translated: The suffix -ta is added to the first half of the root.

original: ait byin pas /🔽aa so s'u tsisht /🔽aa so s'u tsi sh'a t'am /
analyzed: ait byin pas / aa so s'u tsisht / aa so s'u tsi sh'a t'am /
translated: The suffix -ta is added.🔽[The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root a.🔽[The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root a.

original: aa so s'u tsi sha ta /
analyzed: aa so s'u tsi sha ta /
translated: [The word] “each” is [formed] by adding -ta to the root a.🔽And so forth.

original: sogs so // lit la /
analyzed: sogs so // lit la /
translated: In the aphorism,

original: k'asa sogs kyi a'ama sbyar /
analyzed: k'asa sogs kyi a'ama sbyar /
translated: kā and so forth add -am.

original: ya'i hal las 'os ya phyis pas /🔽so s'u ts'am tsa kre /🔽so s'u ts'i ba bh'u ba /
analyzed: ya'i hal las 'os ya phyis pas / so s'u ts'am tsa kre / so s'u ts'i ba bh'u ba /

analyzed: sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'ata ya dant'a:sa m'a pt'a:/

analyzed: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las yang gi mtha' rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus ends the section on the final particles of the Paniniya Vyākaraṇa.

original: // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las yang @393a * //

translated: This concludes the rough notes on the meaning of the great treatise on grammar, the Paniniya Vyākaraṇa, including the text, commentary, rules, examples, and so on, called The Chariot that Guides the Jewel of Eloquence.

original: rkyen gyi mtha' can rnams kyi cho ga spyir btang dmigs bsal dang bcas pa rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtha' can rnams kyi cho ga spyir btang dmigs bsal dang bcas pa rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: The general and specific rules for the final particles ending in ya are now complete.

analyzed: // / da ni yang rkyen 'jig pa'i cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste / ya do&amp ; tsi tsa /

original: yang gi aa tsa la yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi aa tsa la yang ngo //

original: byings mtha'i tsha yig dang ba yig ni krita sogs kyi rkyen kva dang / rjes su sna ldan dang / dzhal dang bo ka nga 'gro ba'i ming can rnams pha rol la rim pa bzhin tsha\ sha\ dang ba\ a'u tha zhes bar bsgyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: byings mtha'i tsha yig dang ba yig ni krita sogs kyi rkyen kva dang / rjes su sna ldan dang / dzhal dang bo ka nga 'gro ba'i ming can rnams pha rol la rim pa bzhin tsha\ sha\ dang ba\ a'u tha zhes bar bsgyur bar bya'o //
translated: The final ca and ba of a verbal root are changed to ṣa and ṣa, respectively, when followed by the affix ktvā, and when followed by the affix ana, and when followed by the affix jhalabbokara.

original: 'grel par lu ba drangs pa /
analyzed: 'grel par lu ba drangs pa /
translated: The commentary cites the following:

original: yang lu ki sh'u thoo b'a dzha li ba ka re /
analyzed: yang lu ki sh'u thoo b'a dzha li ba ka re /
translated: Also, lukisutho bā jhalibabkara.

original: yang 'jig pa la shra a'u tha dag dzha la dang ba yig la yang na'o //
analyzed: yang 'jig pa la shra a'u tha dag dzha la dang ba yig la yang na'o //
translated: Also, in destruction, śra and autha are changed to jhala and ba, respectively.

original: byings mtha'i tsha yig dang ba yig dag yang 'jig pa na /
analyzed: byings mtha'i tsha yig dang ba yig dag yang 'jig pa na /
translated: The final ca and ba of a verbal root are also changed to ṣa and ṣa, respectively, in destruction.

original: kdit ma yin kyang dzhal dang po can dang ba yig pha rol la rim pa bzhin sha\ a'u tha dag tu yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: kdit ma yin kyang dzhal dang po can dang ba yig pha rol la rim pa bzhin sha\ a'u tha dag tu yang na 'gyur te /
translated: Even though it is not ktvā, when followed by the affix jhalabbokara and the affix ba, they are changed to ṣa and ṣa, respectively.
